subject: Use meta-generic to provide Tizen common package groups
commitMessage:
Use meta-generic to provide Tizen common package groups

Due to a name conflict, meta-common cannot be used to provide
Tizen common package groups. Tizen Common defines %_profile 'common'
which means two different meta-common RPMs.

Move all common patterns to meta-generic and use that in addition
to profile specific patterns.

Change-Id: Icea1b016eeea6e113d41b9a80422312d5f48a8aa
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-807

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

this is confused to me ... may someone double check

Patch Set 1:

Philippe: see the discussion in PTREL-807

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks good. 

Next steps:
- review package-groups
- update profile/common/meta
- update profile/ivi/meta-ivi
- sync ourselves to submit a single grouped submission for image-configuration, package-groups and meta-generic on a single project

Patch Set 1:

Looks good. 

Next steps:
- review image-configurations
- update profile/common/meta
- update profile/ivi/meta-ivi
- sync ourselves to submit a single grouped submission for image-configuration, package-groups and meta-generic on a single project

Patch Set 1:

When Tizen:Generic is used, "-common" mean real "common". But now the Tizen:Common age, I suggest we don't use "-generic"  for real "generic".

How about let's use "/p/u/meta-default" to avoid all potential conflicts?
Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
